replies.body:
I dunno why everyone is saying send a support ticket. I was pulled up for a racist term (g o 0 k) when I was questioning whether someone on the other team was being deliberately racist or if they mistyped (the phrase which was a big factor in the suspension, word for word from chat logs, was "did you say g o 0 k or good?"). In the interest of full disclosure I also said "neck yourself" to a particularly horrid little bastard. But the use of a racist term was a big part of the suspension.

Clarified with riot who agreed that I was using the term to clarify the intent of the other player and not to insult. 14 day suspension stood and they said they respected my right to quit the game (or in other words, they told me to get fucked even though they agreed that the suspension trigger was not interpreted properly by the system).

Apparently the c word gets picked up because the script was written by an american and not an Australian, which kinda sucks balls too.

Anyway, good luck with that support ticket.

You should have received a notification in the client informing you of the ban and reason for it, as well as any chat logs (if applicable). You should also have received an email to the registered email address with a notification of the ban and any chat logs (if applicable). If you have not received either of those, you can submit a ticket to [Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) requesting a reason and, if applicable, chat logs (be sure to set the request type as "I have a question about a suspension or restriction on my account"). If you believe the ban to be a false positive, you can submit a ticket to Support to appeal the ban, at which point the case will undergo a manual review.

If you have any other questions or concerns, you can feel free to post on the boards or submit a ticket to [Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new
